content:
Nice clash, just needs a couple of clarifications.
Like Tanvir_Ahmed mentions, you need to specify that the system starts at 0 energy (STATEMENT).
Also, you need to clarify (CONSTRAINTS) that there will never be a test case where the energy both goes below 0 AND above Q (which would lead to a challenge of deciding which issue to output).
It would have been better to state the initial charge level of the battery or indicate that the battery would initially be empty.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Fun and original puzzle. I would be very happy if I saw this puzzle while clashing.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I think this would be a great Clash of Code but it did take me awhile because you need to output the max (which I think is fine) but maybe find a way to put emphasis on that.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I accept this contribution because the description is clear and concise, the test cases are well-defined and comprehensive, the puzzle can reasonably be solved within five minutes, and I have verified it by coding my own working solution.

Goal
* Please format "Storage Exceeded" and "Power Outage" as {{constants}} instead of in <<bold>>.

Input
* Line 1: Please add "(integer)" after "[[Q]]".

* Line 3: Please add "space-separated" before "integers".

Output
* Please format "Storage Exceeded" and "Power Outage" as {{constants}} and remove the quotation marks.

Constraints
* Please change the limits of 10^9, −10^6, 10^6 so that the constraints reflect the actual test coverage more accurately.

Game modes
* Suggest to disable Reverse mode because it looks like impossible to guess the requirement in that mode.

Cases
* Some pairs of cases are the same. Please revise them so that each pair of cases are *similar and different*.

Thanks.

Thank you for your detailed feedback and suggestions regarding the problem statement. 

I have incorporated your comments and made the necessary adjustments.

If any additional modifications are required or further feedback arises, I am happy to make further adjustments. 

Please let me know if there are any other points to address.

Thank you for following up.

Cases
* Please revise these pairs of cases so that they are similar and different:
  • Test 6 and Validator 6.
  • Test 7 and Validator 7.
  • Test 8 and Validator 8.

* Test 4, Test 5, Validator 4 and Validator 5 are missing.

Thanks again.

Thank you for your continued feedback and for catching those missing cases. 
I’ve made the necessary revisions while sneaking in some creative titles to make testing a little more fun
